Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Just to correct myself, I see that Stack DID mention the relation to the
Ho=
stQueuesFrontier. I need to have my eyes checked :smile:
 
- Kris

-----Ori=
ginal Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-cr=
awler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Kristinn Sigurdsson
Sent: 4. ma=ED 2005=
 15:22
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [archive-crawler] N=
ot possible to override
"max-document-download"


What Stack fails to menti=
on is that the DomainSensitiveFrontier is based on
the now deprecated HostQ=
ueuesFrontier.
 
A possible workaround for you Soren, would be to create a =
processor and a
filter that attaches to the scope.
 
The processor would be=
 somewhere after the fetch part of the chain. It would
simply tally the num=
ber of URIs that pass through for each host. It would
also provide static a=
ccess to look-ups on any of these values. Actually, the
StatisticsTracker d=
oes keep track of this at the moment, but you cant access
the information i=
n a useful fashion.
 
The filter (which is going to be a part of the scope)=
 would then check with
this processor for each URI to see if its host has e=
xceeded its maximum
value. The filters maximum value would be configurable =
and, more
importantly, overridable in the usual manner.
 
Set the Preselect=
or to recheck scope and once a host has exceeded its max,
all other URIs be=
longing to it will be tossed.
 
Any other (more elegant) solutions would re=
quire tinkering with the
BdbFrontier.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
=
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.c=
om] On Behalf Of stack
Sent: 4. ma=ED 2005 15:06
To: archive-crawler@yahoog=
roups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Not possible to override
"max-docu=
ment-download"


svc@... wrote:

> It would be nice for us, if we could o=
verride the "max-document-download"
> setting, i.e have it defined pr. doma=
in
> We are planning to crawl a bunch of domains in a single job, but need =
to
> set a limit to the number of objects crawled for each of the domains.
=
>
> This seems not to be possible in the current version of heritrix.
> May=
be this could be implemented instead as a processor.
> Suggestions are very=
 welcome.

Take a look at the DomainSensitiveFrontier (See 
'6.1.2.3. Domai=
nSensitveFrontier' in the User Manual 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/=
user_manual.html#modules).  This 
frontier allows specification of maximum =
documents per domain adding a 
filter to a domain-specific override to prev=
ent further downloads once 
the maximum has been reached.  The DSF is based=
 on Heritrix's previous 
default frontier, the HostQueuesFrontier so your c=
rawls will not be as 
long lasting -- but perhaps it will be sufficent to y=
our purposes (I've 
added a feature request that we add this ability to the=
 BdbFrontier:  
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=3Ddetail
<htt=
p://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=3Ddetail&aid=3D1195298&group_id=
=3D7
3833&atid=3D539102).> &aid=3D1195298&group_id=3D73833&atid=3D539102).
=
St.Ack

>
> regards
> -----------------------------------------------------=
-------
> S=F8ren Vejrup Carlsen, DDA, Det Kongelige Bibliotek
> tlf: (+45)=
 33 47 48 41
> email: svc@...
> email: svc@...

s omnes
